Púkel-men were the ancient carved images
column2: that lined the road to Dunharrow
column4: in the White Mountains. One statue was standing in each turn of the winding road; each resembled a man with clumsy limbs
column5: squatting cross-legged with his short arms folded across his fat belly.

column1: These were carved by the ancient
column2: long-forgotten men of the Second Age
column4: who populated the White Mountains. The statues were thought to be in the likeness of Woses or Drúedain
column5: who also had made their homes there. All had eroded over the years until some had no features except empty eye holes.  The Rohirrim ignored the statues when they passed them.

column1: The word púcel in Old English means "little goblin".
column2: note 14 The element púc "goblin" is related to the name Wikipedia:Puck and the modern English word "pug".
